summary: The Shared Property Agency Collaboration and Engagement Act of 2025 (SPACE Act of 2025) mandates the Administrator of the General Services Administration (GSA) to collaborate with federal tenants on shared-space arrangements, as defined by section 2302 of the Thomas R. Carper Water Resources Development Act of 2024. The bill requires the GSA to identify concerns, develop criteria for expanded space-sharing, identify improvements for special-use spaces, and establish measurable objectives. The Administrator must brief relevant congressional committees on the implementation within six months of the Act's enactment.
